Restore data with ease through js.

Simply pass your data as JSON to `$instance.restore(data)` and restore

data array from store.

Fixes an issue affecting multi-line Text blocks

Basically, if the user would create new lines in a Text block by pressing Shift + Enter, when hitting the backspace key with the caret at the first position of any line (except the first one), the block would be merged into the previous one instead of merging the lines. Also, just the content one the first line would be kept.

Moved uploadable events hookup to uploadable.js

When they were in the image block, it made the droppable and uploadable
controls hard to use separately. It also clobbered the image block's
`onBlockRender` method, meaning that if you overrided it you had to
seemingly unnecessarily re-implement the events hookup.

Merge pull request #381 from rafaelbeckel/master

FIX Firefox file upload

Fix error TypeError in validationFailMsg

If `this.title` is not function then method `validationFailMsg` throws exception:

```
TypeError: this.title is not a function()
```

If this error occurs on `on_post` form's event - browser reloaded and data magically way didn't saved.

A cleaner fix for array conversion

Thanks to @raffij

Per bower/bower.json-spec@a325da3

Update video.js

Quick tweak... had it trip over it's self on a youtu.be site but have made adjustments to resolve.

Update video.js

Further tweak to vimeo (had to add a hacky method to get it to behave on standard vimeo video addresses hence the missing 'm' on '.com' since branch reset isn't allowed which would have resulted in 2 groups being returned by other methods)

Improved regex

Modified the Regex as I discovered it would only select the first character of a video id on youtube (also added in allowance to just post the straight url rather than the share link but I haven't tested it on every permutation of the youtube videos yet but seems to behave ok).

Also rejigged the vimeo link too since it wasn't just picking up the videos id (always the last backslash element) but whole path. So for example ```https://vimeo.com/channels/nicetype/98431335``` would get returned as ```channels/nicetype/98431335``` rather than just ```98431335```. This has been resolved. 

Going forwards I might look at converting the url to an object and extracting details based off that - something like https://gist.github.com/aymanfarhat/5608517 for example.

Changed scribeOptions - allowblockelements to 'true' to prevent extra BR tags being added

Renamed saveAndReturnData to getData

Fixed spelling in tests

Rename saveAndGetData to getBlockData

Saving feels like implementation detail. getData() is the
main public method for getting the data and in most cases
users will want that data to be saved in the store as well.
BlockStore.getData is now BlockStore._getData as it's private

Rename Block._toData to _serializeData

I think this is a better name.
Block.toData is now Block._toData as it's private

Block.toData now just serialises; Block.save just saves

Previously, Block.toData would save data too, which is an
unexpected side-effect.

Events now emitted through per-editor mediator

Rationalised mediatedevents into a mixin. Changed some
names to be more friendlier.

Ported to the new Browserify architecture by @dwb
Renamed files to make some more sense

Tests now JSHinted and we're now in strict mode.

Fixed up the inheritance in SimpleBlock -> Block for strict mode too.

Updated JSHint and fixed all errors

Enabled some new JSHint errors too.

Modularised as CommonJS with Browserify

Using Karma for test running with Browserify, producing a debug build
too. A couple of breaking API changes: `SirTrevor.DEFAULTS` is now
`SirTrevor.config.defaults`, and `SirTrevor.instances` is now
`SirTrevor.config.instances`.
Fix npm scripts paths
Updated to node 0.10.33 for Travis

Using ES5/6 functions instead of Underscore; Jasmine 2.1
